sn1.20:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha in the Hot Springs Monastery.
sn1.20:1.3: Then Venerable Samiddhi rose at the crack of dawn and went to the hot springs to bathe.
sn1.20:1.4: When he had bathed and emerged from the water he stood in one robe drying himself.
sn1.20:1.5: Then, late at night, a glorious deity, lighting up the entire hot springs, went up to Venerable Samiddhi, and, standing in the air, addressed him in verse:
sn1.20:2.1: “Bhikkhu, you seek alms without having eaten
sn1.20:2.2: instead of seeking alms after having eaten.
sn1.20:2.3: But you should eat first, then seek alms:
sn1.20:2.4: don’t let the time pass you by.”
sn1.20:3.3: That’s why I seek alms without having eaten,
sn1.20:3.4: so that the time may not pass me by!”
sn1.20:4.1: Then that deity landed on the ground and said to Venerable Samiddhi,
sn1.20:4.2: “You’ve gone forth while young, bhikkhu. With pristine black hair, you’re blessed with youth, in the prime of life, and you’ve never flirted with sensuality.
sn1.20:4.4: Don’t give up what is presently evident to chase after what involves time.”
sn1.20:5.1: “Friend, I’m not giving up what is presently evident to chase after what involves time.
sn1.20:5.2: I’m giving up what involves time to chase after what is presently evident.
sn1.20:5.3: For the Buddha has said that sensuality involves time, with much suffering and distress, and the peril there is what’s greater.
sn1.20:5.4: But this Dhamma is presently evident, not involving time, verifiable, and goading-on, to be known by the wise for themselves.”
sn1.20:6.1: “But in what way, bhikkhu, has the Buddha said that sensuality involves time, with much suffering and distress, and that the peril there is what’s greater”?
sn1.20:6.2: And how is this Dhamma presently evident, not involving time, verifiable, and goading-on, to be known by the wise for themselves?”
sn1.20:7.1: “Friend, I’m junior, recently gone forth, newly come to this teaching-and-discipline.
sn1.20:7.2: I’m not able to explain this in detail.
sn1.20:7.3: But the Blessed One, the Arahant, the fully awakened Buddha is staying near Rājagaha in the Hot Springs Monatery.
sn1.20:7.4: You should go to him and ask about this matter.
sn1.20:7.5: And you should remember it in line with the Buddha’s answer.”
sn1.20:8.1: “It’s not easy for us to approach the Buddha, as he is surrounded by other illustrious deities.
sn1.20:8.2: If you go to the Buddha and ask him about this matter, we’ll come along and listen to the Dhamma.”
sn1.20:8.3: “Yes, friend,” Venerable Samiddhi replied. He went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and informed him of the matter. Then he added:
sn1.20:17.4: “Bhante, if that deity spoke the truth, he’ll be close by.”
sn1.20:18.1: When he had spoken, that deity said to Venerable Samiddhi,
sn1.20:18.2: “Ask, bhikkhu, ask! For I have arrived.”
sn1.20:19.1: Then the Buddha addressed the deity in verse:
sn1.20:20.2: and are established in the describable.
sn1.20:20.4: they fall under the yoke of Death.
sn1.20:21.1: But having fully understood the describable,
sn1.20:21.2: he does not conceive ‘one who describes’,
sn1.20:21.4: by which one could designate him.
sn1.20:21.5: Tell me if you understand, spirit.”
sn1.20:22.1: “I don’t understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.
sn1.20:22.2: Please teach me this matter so I can understand the detailed meaning.”
sn1.20:23.2: conceiving like this, one falls into conflict.
sn1.20:23.3: Unwavering in the face of the three discriminations,
sn1.20:23.4: ‘equal or superior’ do not occur to him.
sn1.20:23.5: Tell me if you understand, spirit.”
sn1.20:24.1: “I don’t understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.
sn1.20:24.2: Please teach me this matter so I can understand the detailed meaning.”
sn1.20:25.1: “He has given up designation; he does not come into measurement.
sn1.20:25.2: He has cut off craving here—in relation to name-and-form.
sn1.20:25.3: He’s cut all ties, untroubled, free from hope.
sn1.20:25.4: Though gods and humans search for him
sn1.20:25.5: in this world and the world beyond, they never find him,
sn1.20:25.6: not in heaven nor in any abode.
sn1.20:26.1: Tell me if you understand, spirit.”
sn1.20:27.1: “This is how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement:
sn1.20:28.1: One should never do anything bad
sn1.20:28.2: by speech or mind or body in all the world.
sn1.20:28.3: Having given up sensuality, recollected and aware,
sn1.20:28.4: one shouldn’t engage in what’s painful and unbeneficial.”
